metadata.title: CVE-2020-7059 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: When using fgetss() function to read data with stripping tags, in PHPversions 7.2.x below 7.2.27, 7.3.x below 7.3.14 and 7.4.x below 7.4.2 it ispossible to supply data that will cause this function to read past theallocated buffer. This may lead to information disclosure or crash.

criterions.comment: php5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
